title: Derek Ogle
text:
I was a fisheries and statistics professor at Northland College for 26 years until 2022, when I decided to pursue other interests. Use the menu above to see my professional achievements and personal interests.







Ogle, Northumberland, England







Ice Caves at Meyer’s Beach, Lake Superior, 2008







Halibut Fishing, Homer, Alaska, 2011







Lake Superior Storm, North Shore, MN, 2013







Trolling in the Apostle Islands, Lake Superior







Muskeg Property, Oulu, WI







Canyonlands, Utah







Carved Sockeye, Vancouver, BC, Canada







Kim and I at Weaver’s Needle, AZ, 2022







Sunset over Iqaluit, Nunavut, 2016







Home, Bayfield County, 2015







Kim and I on a glacier, Iceland, 2022







Banff, Aberta, Canada, 2013







Road to Home, Bayfield County, WI, 2008







Flowers at Muskeg Property, Oulu, WI







Superstition Mountain, Apache Junction, AZ, 2017

objectID: personal/Hiking/IA Echo Valley Environmental Nature Trail.html
href: personal/Hiking/IA Echo Valley Environmental Nature Trail.html
title: Echo Valley Enviromental Nature Trail
text: Cash and I walked the Echo Valley Environmental Nature Trail near Echo Valley State Park just outside of West Union once in Summer (3-Jul) 2022 and again in Winter (25-Jan) 2023. The trail starts in Echo Valley State Park and follow Otter Creek for approximately 1.5 miles. It is an easy flat trail on an old railroad (or road). The scenery was beautiful, especially in the winter. Details are below.

objectID: personal/Hiking/IA Echo Valley Environmental Nature Trail.html#walk-specific-map
href: personal/Hiking/IA Echo Valley Environmental Nature Trail.html#walk-specific-map

title: Derek Ogle
text:
Iowa Hiking





I was born and raised in Iowa. When I return home now to see family, we try to explore some of the beautiful areas in Northeast (and some in East) Iowa. Below are some of our hikes.


Specific Hikes
Below are some specific hikes that we found interesting.

Pulpit Rock
Echo Valley Environmental Nature Trail

coming - Backbone 2022 - Bighorn Rd

title: Derek Ogle
text:
Iron River Area Hiking





For exercise and for getting to know the area in which I have lived for the last three decades, Cash and I have been walking many of the roads and back-country trails in the Iron River WI area. Below are the places we have walked thusfar. Some specific walks are highlighted in the next section.












Interactions with Map




Red is highway, Blue is paved road, Orange is gravel road, Yellow is offroad (ATV but possible 4WD vehicle), Green is trail (hiking but some ATV), and Brown is designated ATV/Snowmobile (only) trail.
Hover on track to see track abbreviation.
Click on track to get track information.
Use +/- in upper-left to zoom.
Use object in upper-right to change base map type.
Use object in lower-left to make measurements on map.



 


Specific Hikes
Below are some specific hikes that we found interesting.

Camp Nine Research Area East

title: Derek Ogle
text:
Superstition Wilderness Hiking





Kim’s Mom has a place near Superstition Mountain which we try to visit annually. In 2022 I started mapping hikes that we made in the Superstition Wilderness. Those hikes are shown below. More information on some specific walks is in the next section.












Interactions with Map




Red were from 2022 and Orange is from 2023.
Hover on track to see track abbreviation.
Click on track to get track information.
Use +/- in upper-left to zoom.
Use object in upper-right to change base map type.
Use object in lower-left to make measurements on map.



 


Specific Hikes
Specific hikes that we have enjoyed are highlighted below.

Wave Cave, 2022
Hieroglyphics Trail, 2022
Weaver’s Needle (Peralta & Cave Trail Loop), 2022
Black Top Mesa (from First Waters TH), 2022
Massacre Grounds, 2022

 


Other Resources

Superstition (and Mazatzal) Wilderness on ArizonaHiking.org
Superstition Wilderness Hiking Trails on TrailForks
Tonto National Forest on TrailForks … largely the same as above
Hikes in Tonto National Forest on 10 Adventures … search on “Superstition”
Best Hiking Trails in the Superstition Mountains
20 Superstition Mountains Hiking Trails You Can’t Miss
Superstition Wilderness Hikes on HikeArizona.com … fairly dated
6 Superstition Mountain Hikes You Won’t Want to Miss
Superstition Wilderness on AllTrails … need an account
GPX files for Superstition Wilderness by Michael Thorne

objectID: personal/Hiking/SW Black Top Mesa FW TH.html
href: personal/Hiking/SW Black Top Mesa FW TH.html
title: Black Top Mesa from First Water TH
text: On March 9, 2022 Kim and I hiked to Black Top Mesa from the First Water trailhead via Dutchman’s and Bull Pass trails. This was a long walk for us (~12.5 mi) but offered stunning views of Weaver’s Needle from the north, which we had not seen before. The climb up to the top was steep but the trail was fairly easy to navigate. We returned to the trailhead via the Black Mesa and Second Water trails. There were many more cacti no the trail back. Fun hike. Details are below.

objectID: personal/Hiking/SW Black Top Mesa FW TH.html#overview-map

title: Hieroglphyics Canyon

title: Weaver’s Needle
text: On March 8, 2022 Kim and I hiked out to see Weaver’s Needle from Fremont Saddle. The Peralta Trail (102) portion is a steep climb to Fremont Saddle for a great view of Weaver’s Needle. We took a short walk out to a Pinion tree for a closer view of the Needle. The Cave Trail portion was a challenge to find and included some scrambling. A fun trail all around. Details are below.

title: Wave Cave
text: On March 6, 2022 Kim and I hiked from the first Peralta Trailhead parking area to the “Wave Cave” via the Lost Goldmine, Carney Springs, and Wave Cave trails. The trail was fairly flat until the Wave Cave trail portion, which ascended quickly. The actual cave was larger than I expected and offered up some great photos. There were a decent number of people on the trail on this beautiful day. Details are below.

title: Wave Cave

title: Derek Ogle
text: My wife Kim and I particularly like to travel and take walks with our sheltie Cash (as we did with Jem and Jordan). I also tend to our Oulu property, fish, boat, cross-country ski, snowshoe, attend live music, and smoke fish and meat. I also make occasional TV appearances, the most famous of these is my appearance on Diners, Drive-Ins, and Dives.

title: Derek Ogle
text:
Kim and I enjoy all kinds of live music, particularly at Big Top Chautauqua, which is only an hour from home. I primarily listen to blues-rock (think SRV, KWS, etc) and outlaw country (Waylon, Willie, etc.) but we have been know to travel good distances to see Michael Franti, JJ Grey & Mofro, Ronnie Baker Brooks, and Corey Carlson.



Click the image above to see some of the musicians that we have met.

title: Oulu Property
text: I will be adding content.

title: Derek Ogle
text:
Cash
Cash is our current sheltie who we have had since September 2021. He is a spirited “big pony” who loves to be outside, especially on walks/hikes.

Week_081






 


Jem
Jem was our sheltie who graced our lives from April(ish) 2009 to almost August 2018. Many people knew Jem from seeing him around the Science Center during the school year. Jem was such a special dog … very smart, incredibly loyal, and always watching over and protecting us. While he was a little snooty and often turned up his nose at “strangers”, he also melted your heart if he decided to give you the time of day. Here is a short piece that I wrote about Jem a few years ago.
Jem was taken from us way too early, though we know he is now with his “grandpa owner” taking walks, sitting on the couch together, and scheming to get those chippies. RIP “poundy”, I wish we would have had more time together, you were such a special little guy!! We will see you again (Thanks Ronnie … beautiful song).














































































 


Jordan
Jordan was the sheltie that Kim and I got soon after we were married. “Jordo” enriched our lives from April, 1991 until March 2006.
We miss the walks and boat rides. RIP “Bordo Dog”!!!

title: Derek Ogle
text:
Diners, Drive-Ins, and Dives
Kim and I appeared, with speaking “parts”, on *Diners, Drive-Ins, and Dives when Guy visited the Delta Diner, an amazing restaurant near our home.

  



Travel Wisconsin
I also had a cameo on a Travel Wisconsin piece about Big Top Chautauqua. Unfortunately it looks like the piece is no long available, which is OK, because for some reason they focused most clips of my wife and her family.


HS Basketball at Carver-Hawkeye
I was part of the Linn-Mar team that played the only high school basketball game at the University of Iowa’s Carver-Hawkeye Arena. If you look closely in some of these clips you can see that I had a good seat for the action!

title: Derek Ogle
text:
I worked for Northland College as a fisheries and statistics professor for 26 years until 2022. I believe in Northland’s mission and core values surrounding the environment, sustainability, and social justice. I very much enjoyed helping students to reach their academic and career goals.
While at Northland (and both before and since) I had opportunities to pursue my own scholarly interests. Towards that end I authored a fisheries-related book, book chapter, and several journal articles, and developed software mostly related to fisheries analyses.
Though retired from that career I still, as part of the fishR core team, actively maintain the fishR webpage1 and several fisheries-related R packages.
My professional record is recorded on my CV and in the links above and below.

        





Footnotes


Resources for performing fisheries analyses in R.↩︎

title: Publications
text:
I am sorry that I cannot provide full access to these books.




Introductory Fisheries Analyses with R
Growth Estimation: Growth Models and Statistical Inference in Age and Growth of Fishes: Principles and Techniques

title: Publications
text:
Journal Articles






Most links below are to paywalled sites. Please contact me via e-mail for a PDF of the article.




Age and Growth - Modeling

Evaluating the performance of methods used to estimate growth parameters from subsampled age data
Use and misuse of a common growth metric: guidance for appropriately calculating and reporting specific growth rate
Estimating age at a specified length from the von Bertalanffy growth function, with R Supplement
An Algorithm for the von Bertalanffy Seasonal Cessation in Growth Function of Pauly et al. (1992), with R Supplement
Clarification of Somer’s Seasonal Growth Model
Temporal Signatured Introduction
Probabilistic Age Assignments with Temporal Signatures



Age and Growth - Life History

A synthesis of the biology and ecology of sculpin species in the Great Lakes (with student)
Size and Age of Stonecats in Lake Champlain
Age, year-class strength variability, and partial age validation of Coregonus kiyi from Lake Superior Data repository (with student)
Age, Growth, and Size of Lake Superior Pygmy Whitefish (with student)
Hatchery Lake Trout Scale Characteristics



Ruffe Research

Effect of Removing Ruffe on Ruffe Populations
Ruffe Weight-Length Relationships with a Proposed Standard Weight Equation
Freezing Effect on Ruffe Length-Weight Relationships
Larval Ruffe Diet (with student)
Overview of Ruffe
Ruffe Diet and Diel Movements
Predation on Ruffe



Miscellaneous

A comparison of fish catch rates among local, non-local, and non-resident anglers of three northern Wisconsin lakes (with student)
Life history variation in Arctic charr from Cumberland Sound, Nunavut
Production dynamics reveal hidden overharvest of inland recreational fisheries
Recent Declines in Gray Jays on Christmas Bird Counts in Northern Wisconsin (with student)
Mayfly Populations in Chequamegon Bay: 2002 and 2012 (with student)
Misuse of “Gender”” in Fisheries Publications
Crayfish Trap Defense (with student)
Community and Place in Outdoor Orientation Programs - pub 1, pub 2 (with student)

title: Software
text:
FSA (Fisheries Stock Assessment): R functions to conduct typical introductory fisheries analyses. Example analyses that use FSA are in the Introductory Fisheries Analyses with R book.
FSAdata: A companion to FSA with data sets for use in common fisheries analyses.
RFishBC: Helps collect measurements from calcified structures and back-calculate estimated lengths at previous ages.







These packages are now maintained by the fishR-Core-Team, of which I am a member.

title: Software
text:
Unreleased R Packages

FSAWs: For constructing and validating standard weight (Ws) equations for fish.
NCStats: Helper functions for statistics courses at Northland College.







Other packages that are less well-developed or maintained are available on my Github page

title: Software
text:
Contributions to Other R Packages

plotrix::histStack(): Construct histograms with bars stacked according to a categorical variable.
pgirmess::kruskalmc(): A generic wrapper function for performing multiple comparisons for a Kruskal-Wallis test.
car::leveneTest(): A generic wrapper function for performing Levene’s homogeneity of variances test.
plotrix::plotH(): Construct histogram-like modifications of scatterplots.

title: Software
text:
Websites

fishR website







This website is now maintained by the fishR-Core-Team, of which I am a member.
